Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Shanty \Shan"ty\, a. Jaunty; showy. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Shanty \Shan"ty\, n.;pl. {Shanties}. [Said to be fr. Ir. sean old + tig. a house.] A small, mean dwelling; a rough, slight building for temporary use; a hut. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Shanty \Shan"ty\, v. i. To inhabit a shanty. --S. H. Hammond. [1913 Webster]
shanty n 1: small crude shelter used as a dwelling [syn: {hovel}, {hut}, {hutch}, {shack}] 2: a rhythmical work song originally sung by sailors [syn: {chantey}, {chanty}, {sea chantey}]
